tests.name: OB
tests.sourceText: Gravity is the force of attraction between objects with mass. It's responsible for keeping planets in orbit around the sun, causing objects to fall to Earth, and holding stars and galaxies together. The strength of gravity depends on the mass of the objects and the distance between them; more mass results in a stronger pull, and greater distance results in a weaker pull.
